title: IBC 2015: Ooyala makes ode to joiz
text:
Editor | 11 September 2015 
In a bid to enhance online video and advertising solutions with the ability to power social TV channels, Ooyala has announced a strategic partnership with joiz. 
Based in Switzerland, the joiz community marketing platform offers, analytics, gamification capabilities, loyalty programs, e-commerce and social TV capabilities, joiz boosts audience retention and ad campaign revenues through its cloud-based solution. The company already uses Ooyala's video and ad tech offerings including end-to-end video management, delivery, analytics and ad serving capabilities. 
Under the terms of the new deal, Ooyala believes that joiz channels can further build, maintain and monetise audiences with personalised content recommendations and drive higher CPMs across inventory, giving a clear data-driven strategy that leads directly to increased revenue. Ooyala will also offer video and advertising solutions for two social TV channels, boosting content recommendations and personalisation and ad management. 
"At Ooyala and joiz, our strategic visions are clearly aligned," says Alexander Mazzara, co-founder and chief executive officer of joiz Group . "Together, we can offer media companies an array of video, community marketing and analytics technologies, maximising their power to monetise audiences and embrace smart data." 
"joiz is a company that really understands the massive opportunities of advanced video technologies and is actively forging relationships with new partners," added Rags Gupta, general manager of EMEA for Ooyala ."We're ideally placed to join forces and create something truly compelling for broadcasters."
